    Reference

    Seurat functions (scRNA-Seq)

    Functions using the seurat package

    estimate_ambient_rna()

    Estimate ambient RNA contamination using SoupX

    run_doubletFinder()

    Run DoubletFinder

    calculate_filtering_param()

    Estimate the filtering parameters (MT, nFeature, nCount)

    load_10x_gem()

    Load 10x GEM data

    run_qc_and_filtering()

    Check sample quality and filter the count matrix

    run_seurat_integration()

    Samples integration using seurat

    run_seurat_integration_v5()

    Samples integration using seurat v5 (logNorm only)

    run_integration_with_Ref()

    Samples reference based integration using seurat

    transfer_annotation()

    Function that takes the annotation from one dataset and it transfers it to another one.

    get_loupe_files()

    Dump umap coordinates and metadata to load in the loupe browser

    add_adt_assay()

    Add ADT information to a seurat object

    add_vdj_assay()

    Add VDJ information to a seurat object

    CellCycleScoring_extra()

    Expansion of CellCycleScoring from the seurat package.

    calculate_mito_ribo()

    Calculate the percentage of mitochondrial and ribosomal genes

    calculate_cell_complexity()

    Calculate the complexity of the dataset

    compare_qc()

    Compare 2 seurat object (used to generate QC figures between pre-fitlered and filtered data)

    Annotation functions

    Functions to annotate a dataset

    plot_cell_signature()

    Plot gene signatures

    plot_cells_markers()

    Plot cell markers

    scType_pipeline()

    scType

    ArchR functions (scATAC-Seq)

    Collection of functions to interact with ArchR projects

    archR_subset_by_sample()

    Subset an arcR projects based on sampleID value

    VDJ functions (scVDJ-Seq)

    Collection of functions for TCR/BCR analysis

    bcr_lineage_reconstruction()

    Build and visualise phylogenetic trees on AIRR formatted file

    Enrichment analysis

    Useful functions for enrichment analysis (ORA + GSEA)

    enrichR_analysis()

    Run enrichR

    plot_enrichR_result()

    Generate the enrichment figure for enrichR

    fgsea_rank_genes()

    Rank genes for FGSEA analysis

    Visualisation functions

    Mix of visualisation functions

    VlnPlot_modified()

    Improved violin plot

    Clustered_DotPlot_nl()

    Improved Dotplot

    calculate_cell_proportions()

    Calculate cell proportions

    stemnet_plot()

    Plot a STEMNET object by Circular A Posteriori Projection

    Single-cell utilities

    Useful functions for the analysis of single-cell dataset

    calculate_genes_signature()

    Calcualte genes signature

    Interoperability with external tools

    Useful functions that allow the interaction with external tools (e.g. scanpy)

    export_seurat()

    Export a seurat object to file

    Bulk utilities

    Useful functions for the analysis of bulk dataset

    PCA_genes()

    Function that, given a DESeq2 object, runs PCA and it returns the contributions of the genes to each PCs.

    General utilities

    Mix of functionalities

    convert_ensemble_to_symbol()

    Convert the rownames of a matrix from ensemble to symbol

    mouse_human_gene_conversion()

    Convert gene names from human to mouse

    SaveFigure()

    Wrapper function to save figures to disk.

    Middle_Number()

    Calcualte the middle value

    setup_sc_project()

    Setup project directory structure

    Datsets

    data used by the internal functions (mainly)

    ABIS_markers

    Gene markers of 29 immune cell types

    pbmc_markers

    PBMC markers

    pbmc_markers_annotated

    PBMC markers as data frame

    pbmc_1k

    PBMC 1K test dataset

    MouseHumanGenes

    Mouse-Human gene name mapping table

    ScTypeDB

    ScTypeDB

    Internal

    Internal functions

    Parser

    Parsing the Garnett marker file

    validate_markers()

    Validate markers

    parse_input()

    Parser

    parse_markers_lists()

    Another parser

    markers_lookup()

    Yes, another parser

    modify_scales()

    Modify scales of a Feature Plot.
